subject: Negotiation
title: Dark Patterns in Design
description: A fast breakdown of Dark Patterns in Design for builders.

hook.text: That 'unsubscribe' button is tiny and gray on purpose. The 'subscribe' button is bright and huge. That's a dark pattern.

buildup.text: Dark patterns are user interface designs that trick people into actions they didn't intend to take.

discovery.text: Hidden costs, forced opt-ins, and confusing cancellation flows manipulate decisions through design.

twist.text: Amazon's Prime cancellation process was so complex the EU forced them to simplify it.

climax.text: Recognizing dark patterns in digital negotiations protects you from manipulation you might not see.

punchline.text: If the path to 'no' is harder than the path to 'yes,' someone designed it that way.

quiz.question: What are dark patterns?
options: Visual design themes using dark colors
User interface designs that trick people into unintended actions
